title: Parmesan Crusted Tilapia Fillets Recipe
description: This Parmesan-crusted tilapia uses a few simple ingredients that pack a lot of great flavor. This is a quick, easy dinner, baked to perfection.

About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Never lose a recipe:¬†Join MyRecipes to save and find favorites from AR & beyond Recipes Seafood Fish Tilapia Parmesan Crusted Tilapia Fillets 4.6 (806) 611 Reviews 202 Photos This recipe for Parmesan-crusted tilapia is quick and easy with plenty of flavor! Even my husband (who doesn't like fish that much) went back for seconds. Works well in low-carb diets. Submitted by France C Updated on November 14, 2024 Save Rate Print Share Add Photo 202 202 202 202 Prep Time: 10 mins Cook Time: 10 mins Total Time: 20 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings ¬æ cup grated Parmesan cheese 1 tablespoon chopped fresh parsley 2 teaspoons paprika salt and ground black pepper to taste 4 tilapia fillets 1 drizzle olive oil Directions Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil. Whisk Parmesan cheese, parsley, paprika, salt, and pepper together in a shallow dish. Coat tilapia fillets with olive oil and press into the Parmesan cheese mixture. Arrange coated fillets on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes. Sherri I Made It Print 2,162 home cooks made it! Your daily values may be higher or lower depending on your calorie needs. ** Nutrient information is not available for all ingredients. Amount is based on available nutrient data. (-) Information is not currently available for this nutrient. If you are following a medically restrictive diet, please consult your doctor or registered dietitian before preparing this recipe for personal consumption. Yummy 03 of 202 Photo by¬† SilverHerb6597 07/11/2023 Absolutely amazing, second time making and it's so delicious üòçüòç 04 of 202 Photo by¬† kellyl 02/06/2022 Recipe was delicious. Hubby is very picky but he enjoyed it. 05 of 202 Photo by¬† DaniAyn 08/24/2021 06 of 202 Photo by¬† Tidal Creek Farm 08/13/2021 I thought this came out AWESOME....I added a dash of garlic powder but otherwise followed the recipe and it was really nice~!! Thanks for a great recipe!! 07 of 202 Photo by¬† Darryl Chlebowski 05/04/2021 08 of 202 Photo by¬† Winnise Bishop 04/15/2021 09 of 202 Photo by¬† Angie Yew Min Chua 03/26/2021 10 of 202 Photo by¬† Cheryl Luttenegger 03/10/2021 So much flavor! 1 2 3 4 5 Next You‚Äôll Also Love Grilled Tilapia with Tomato-Olive Tapenade 9 Ratings Old Bay Tilapia with Broccoli 11 Ratings Tilapia Foil Packets 10 Ratings Breaded Garlic-Herb Tilapia 2 Ratings Baked Tilapia with Veggies in Foil 2 Ratings Instant Pot Frozen Salmon 39 Ratings Garlic Alfredo Tilapia 458 Ratings Broiled Lemon-Pepper Tilapia 3 Ratings Potato-Crusted Tilapia 2 Ratings Tilapia in Stewed Tomatoes 9 Ratings Easy Pan-Fried Tilapia 1 Rating Pan-Fried Salmon 6 Ratings Pan-Fried Wild Salmon 71 Ratings Tamra's Microwave Tilapia 36 Ratings Butter-Baked Tilapia and Coconut Rice Simple Ranchy Breaded Fish Fillets 448 Ratings Allrecipes Newsletters Follow Us Dinners Meals Ingredients Occasions Cuisines Kitchen Tips News Features About Us Editorial Process Privacy Policy Product Vetting Terms of Service Advertise Careers Contact Your Privacy Choices ¬† Allrecipes is part of the Dotdash Meredith¬†publishing¬†family. name: France C
instructions: Preheat the oven to 400 degrees F (200 degrees C). Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil.;Whisk Parmesan cheese, parsley, paprika, salt, and pepper together in a shallow dish.;Coat tilapia fillets with olive oil and press into the Parmesan cheese mixture. Arrange coated fillets on the prepared baking sheet.;Bake in the preheated oven until the fish flakes easily with a fork, 10 to 12 minutes. Sherri
